intro: Colobium maroccanum, commonly known as the Moroccan spurge, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent-like leaves adapted to dry conditions. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its resilience, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in drought-tolerant gardens.
